name: Rava Idli
history: Rava Idli, originating from Karnataka, is a variation of the traditional idli. It's made from semolina (rava) and is a popular breakfast dish, known for its quick preparation time.
description: Rava Idli is a soft, spongy, and savory cake made from semolina, yogurt, and a leavening agent. It's often flavored with cashews, mustard seeds, and curry leaves, and served with chutney or sambar.

instructions.title: Prepare the Batter
instructions.description: Roast the semolina in a pan until slightly aromatic. Let it cool. Mix the semolina with yogurt, water, and salt to form a batter. Allow it to rest for 15-20 minutes.

instructions.title: Temper the Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, green chilies, curry leaves, and cashews. SautÃ© and then add this tempering to the batter. Mix in the chopped coriander.

instructions.title: Steam the Idlis
instructions.description: Just before steaming, add baking soda to the batter and mix well. Pour the batter into greased idli molds and steam for 10-15 minutes until done.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Rava Idlis hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

tips: The consistency of the batter should be similar to regular idli batter, not too thick or too thin.
Allow the batter to rest so that the semolina absorbs the yogurt, creating a fluffier idli.
variations: Add grated vegetables like carrots or ginger for extra flavor and nutrition.
Experiment with different nuts or seeds for added crunch and taste.

storage.shelfLife: Rava Idli batter can be refrigerated for up to 1 day. Cooked idlis should be consumed fresh.
storage.instructions: Store the batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Reheat idlis in a steamer or microwave.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a steamer or microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve on a platter garnished with grated coconut and a sprig of curry leaf.
